009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
012
013public class DialogUtils {
014        
015        /**
016         * Creates a HTML string by formatting the supplied strings
017         * as individual text lines separated by {@literal <br>}.
018         * The complete text is wrapped by {@literal <html>...</html>}.
019         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addHelp(String)}.
020         * 
021         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
022         * @return a HTML string
023         */
024        public static String makeHtmlString(CharSequence... lines) {
025                return "<html>\n" + String.join("<br>\n", lines) + "\n</html>";
026        }
027        
028        
029        /**
030         * Creates a string by formatting the supplied strings
031         * as individual text lines separated by newline.
032         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addMessage(String)}.
033         * 
034         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
035         * @return a newline-separated string
036         */
037        public static String makeLineSeparatedString(CharSequence... lines) {
038                return String.join("\n", lines);
039        }
040        
041        // ----------------------------------------------------
042        
043        public static void main(String[] args) {
044                String html = makeHtmlString(
045                    "Get busy living or",
046                    "get busy dying.",
047                    "--Stephen King");
048                System.out.println(html);
049                
050                System.out.println();
051                
052                String lines = makeLineSeparatedString(
053                    "Get busy living or",
054                    "get busy dying.",
055                    "--Stephen King");
056                System.out.println(lines);
057        }
058
059}
